Description: a group or individual used as a standard of comparison for checking the results of a survey or experiment.
Location made, or occurring without definite aim, reason, or pattern: characterized selection in which each item of a set has an equal probability of being chosen.
strategically chosen areas of similar chemical and physical characteristics used to compare impacts of disturbed areas

Any site that improves the quality of water to make it more acceptable for a specific end-use. The end use may be drinking, industrial water supply, irrigation, river flow maintenance, water recreation or many other uses, including being safely returned to the environment.
